intro: Galium canum var. musciforme, commonly known as the woolly woodcrushers, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant typically features slender, ascending stems covered in fine, white to grayish hairs. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Galium canum var. musciforme thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
